channel.title: NPR Programs: All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Judge considers whether to detain or release D.C. pipe bomb suspect
item.description: The suspect in the attempted pipe bombing of political headquarters in 2021 appeared in court today for a pre-trial detention hearing.
item.content:encoded: The suspect in the attempted pipe bombing of political headquarters in 2021 appeared in court today for a pre-trial detention hearing.
item.dc:creator: Ryan Lucas

item.title: Pine needles help researchers track how forever chemicals get into the environment
item.description: Volunteers in Minnesota are collecting pine needles to help researchers determine how PFAS -- the substances commonly called forever chemicals -- find their way into water, soil and air.
item.content:encoded: Volunteers in Minnesota are collecting pine needles to help researchers determine how PFAS -- the substances commonly called forever chemicals -- find their way into water, soil and air.
item.dc:creator: Kirsti Marohn

item.title: It was a rough year for nightclubs
item.description: A number of promenant nightclubs and music venues closed across the country in 2025, part of an ongoing trend driven by high rents, decreasing alcohol consumption and monopolization.
item.content:encoded: A number of promenant nightclubs and music venues closed across the country in 2025, part of an ongoing trend driven by high rents, decreasing alcohol consumption and monopolization.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Promoting a movie in 2025 is a performance in itself
item.description: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Nicholas Quah of Vulture about the evolution of celebrity publicity as the "new media circuit" commands more attention.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Nicholas Quah of Vulture about the evolution of celebrity publicity as the "new media circuit" commands more attention.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: What to know about a power struggle among U.S. allies in the Red Sea
item.description: Israel became the first country in the world to recognize Somaliland, part of a wider Red Sea rivalry also playing out in Yemen
item.content:encoded: Israel became the first country in the world to recognize Somaliland, part of a wider Red Sea rivalry also playing out in Yemen
item.dc:creator: Aya Batrawy

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, author and JFK's granddaughter, dies at 35
item.description: Journalist and author Tatiana Schlossberg, the granddaughter of former president John F. Kennedy, has died after battling a rare form of cancer.
item.content:encoded: Journalist and author Tatiana Schlossberg, the granddaughter of former president John F. Kennedy, has died after battling a rare form of cancer.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: An aid group that has worked in Gaza for years responds to Israel's ban
item.description: Israel is halting operations for humanitarian groups working in Gaza. NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Shaina Low with the Norwegian Refugee Council about what that means for aid on the ground.
item.content:encoded: Israel is halting operations for humanitarian groups working in Gaza. NPR's Scott Detrow speaks with Shaina Low with the Norwegian Refugee Council about what that means for aid on the ground.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Dig in to the complex and fascinating history of chocolate
item.description: Throughline host Rund Abdelfatah brings us the story of the origins of chocolate.
item.content:encoded: Throughline host Rund Abdelfatah brings us the story of the origins of chocolate.
item.dc:creator: Rund Abdelfatah

item.title: Flu cases are surging and rates will likely get worse, new CDC data shows
item.description: Flu season is off to a rough start this year, according to new CDC data. The virus is spreading faster than in previous years and the surge is likely to get worse. Here's what you need to know.
item.content:encoded:
Flu season is off to a rough start this year, according to new CDC data. The virus is spreading faster than in previous years and the surge is likely to get worse. Here's what you need to know.

(Image credit: LittleCityLifestylePhotography)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert

item.title: CIA strike escalates the Trump administration's pressure campaign on Venezuela
item.description: A U.S. official confirms that the CIA struck a dock facility on the coast of Venezuela.
item.content:encoded: A U.S. official confirms that the CIA struck a dock facility on the coast of Venezuela.
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman
